FS.content: Apollonian ecstasy cannot embrace force, movement which displaces lines, nor force as desire for itself, nor writing > fallen Dionysianism, melancholy, nostalgia
FS.linkedContent: Apollonian ecstasy cannot embrace force, movement which displaces lines, nor force as desire for itself, nor writing > fallen Dionysianism, melancholy, nostalgia

FS.content: difference btwn Dionysus & Apollo, ardor & structure, cannot be erased in history, because not in history > it’s an original structure, the opening of history, historicity itself
FS.linkedContent: difference btwn Dionysus & Apollo, ardor & structure, cannot be erased in history, because not in history > it’s an original structure, the opening of history, historicity itself

FS.content: Dionysus is worked over by difference, always appears (to himself) by a relationship to his exterior, his death [fire]
FS.linkedContent: Dionysus is worked over by difference, always appears (to himself) by a relationship to his exterior, his death [fire]
